paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant N588K, including penetrance data and functional studies.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Atrial fibrillation and short QT syndrome
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with atrial fibrillation at age 25.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Short QT syndrome with episodes of syncope
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 experienced syncope episodes starting at age 30.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms but carries the variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P3 is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Short QT syndrome with documented arrhythmias
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P4 was diagnosed with SQTS at age 34.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation leads to a gain-of-function in the IKr current.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The N588K mutation is responsible for approximately 90% of SQTS cases.
key_quotes: The N588K missense mutation in the KCNH2 gene accounts for approximately 90% of the positive genotype SQTS cases.
Patient-specific hiPSC-based atrial cellular and tissue models of the SQTS were established.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant N588K was successfully extracted.
